name: Butthole Surfers
description:
'''Butthole Surfers''' are an American [[rock music|rock]] band formed in [[San Antonio|San Antonio, Texas]], by singer [[Gibby Haynes]] and guitarist [[Paul Leary]] in 1981. The band has had numerous personnel changes, but its core lineup of Haynes, Leary, and drummer [[King Coffey]] has been consistent since 1983. [[Teresa Taylor|Teresa Nervosa]] served as second drummer from 1983 to 1985, 1986 to 1989, and 2009. The band has also employed a variety of bass players, most notably [[Jeff Pinkus]].

Emerging from the 1980s [[hardcore punk]] scene, Butthole Surfers quickly became known for their chaotic live shows, [[black comedy]], and a sound that incorporated elements of [[psychedelic music|psychedelia]], [[noise rock]], and [[punk rock|punk]] as well as their use of sound manipulation and tape editing.

Although they were respected by their peers and attracted a devoted fanbase, Butthole Surfers had little commercial success until 1996's ''[[Electriclarryland]]''. The album contained the hit single "[[Pepper (song)|Pepper]]", which climbed to number one on ''[[Billboard (magazine)|Billboard]]''{{'}}s [[Modern Rock Tracks]] chart that year.
